item.title: South Kilburn Open Space by back wall of Perrin House, 20th October
item.description:
A new squatter camp has arrived in South Kilburn Open Space, by the back wall of Perrin House. There is a substantial tent plus a cage for a dog. The dog is a large Alsatian type and is tearing around the park aggressively attacking a container. It seems out of control. A squatter is intimidating people walking through the park by staring aggressively. He looks of similar type to previous squatters in this park who were found to be dealing drugs and storing stolen goods. He looks fairly young and appears fit, strong and intimidating.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Malvern Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Fly-tip Large - More than a van load (Parks)

item.title: Several piles of rubbish on communal staircase, 20th October
item.description:
There are several piles of boxes, furniture, wood and doors blocking the communal stairs, which is supposed to be a fire escape, in the block of 61-70 Lumley Flats SW1W 8LT. All the piles of rubbish are from the same flat with their name and address on the boxes. This has been reported to the landlord (Peabody) repeatedly as far back as February 2025. The landlord has done absolutely nothing and the piles of rubbish are growing and are blocking the fire escape/communal stairwell.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Holbein Place, Belgravia, London
Report on FixMyStreet
